content.description: Find the triangular shaped crack/pod in the center of the boulder, about chest high.  Follow the left leaning seam pretty much straight up.     The top out is kind of exciting, but not ridiculous.
content.protection: A couple of pads and spotters.
content.location: This is center problem on the southwest face.

content.description: Sit start on the good undercling, make some big moves to crimps on the face above and top out.
content.location: On the far left-side of the Burnout Boulder as you're looking at Jones'n. There's a rock close behind you, and a smaller rock near your left leg that make the problem a bit dabby.

content.description: Start on the rail for the fire traverse, and mantle directly up into the seam. This is slightly different from rail to seam, which starts out right.
Sit start on the obvious right facing rail and move up and left through crimps and sidepulls with tricky feet.  The topout can be done direct or by rolling left onto the slabby face.
content.protection: A crashpad or two and a spotter.

content.description: Fire is pronounced Fee-Ray, like the shoes from back in the day.   Start matched on the big jug that starts the left trending rail.  Head up the rail to a pair of bad holds.  From there the holds get better as you head towards the top.
content.protection: The landing is a little odd, and the top is kind of high so a few pads and spotters are very helpful.
content.location: Stand start on the jug on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Start matched on the insecure rail to the right of Jones'n and the start of dusty coffee. Lock off and make a powerful move left, place your feet and dyno to the lip.
content.location: Right of Jones'n and dusty coffee on the thin crimp rail

content.description: Begin right of Jones'n matched on a thin but positive rail.  Find the feet and dyno to the lip.  Will be easier or harder depending on your stature.
content.protection: A crashpad and a spot to keep you out of the tree if you blow it.

content.description: Just uphill to the northeast, the Burnout Boulder has a nice seletion of problems from V2-V8.
